Meaning: The unique identifier for the relation.
The source of the relation.
The genre that the text comes from.
The subgenre that the text comes from (novel only)
The original language that the text was uttered in.
The ID of the speaker (Europarl only)
The reference label (wikipedia and PDTB relations only)
The number of crowdsourced participants that provided an annotation for the item.
The maximum number of participants that agreed on a single sense for the item.
A distribution of probabilities for every PDTB3 level 3 relation sense for the item, based on majority votes.
A single sense annotation for the item; sampled in case two or more senses received the same number of votes.
Combination of all senses that reached a threshold of 20% agreement. In cases where no sense reached the threshold for an instance, the majoritylabel_sampled was assigned.
Combination of all senses that reached a threshold of 40% agreement. In cases where no sense reached the threshold for an instance, the majoritylabel_sampled was assigned.
A distribution of probabilities for every PDTB3 level 3 relation sense for the item, based on the item response model.
The label identified by the item response model as the most likely true label.
The probability assigned by the item response model to the most likely true label.
A distribution of probabilities for every PDTB3 level 3 relation sense for the item, based on CrowdTruth.
The label identified by the CrowdTruth model as the most likely true label.
The probability assigned by the CrowdTruth model to the most likely true label.
Combination of all senses that reached a threshold of 20% agreement. In cases where no sense reached the threshold for an instance, the crowdtruthlabel_single was assigned.
Combination of all senses that reached a threshold of 40% agreement. In cases where no sense reached the threshold for an instance, the crowdtruthlabel_single was assigned.
The connective that was most frequently inserted in the first step of the two-step DC annotation method (free text).
The connective that was most frequently inserted in the second step of the two-step DC annotation method (forced choice).
The first argument of the relation embedded in its context.
The second argument of the relation embedded in its context.
The text that makes up the first argument of the relation.
The text that makes up the second argument of the relation.
